page.title: 18A walk near Lutton.
page.content: On our walk from Lutton we went through some fields used for grazing. On one side there was a wood and a stream. Soon we came to a road. There was a cottage near-by and a wood of larch trees. We went into Slade. Sometimes there are sheep grazing there. By Slade House is a wood and there is a pony in a paddock. A path goes from the drive, along by the wood and under the viaduct. We went through the wood along a path. Soon we came to a road and we went along it, over a stream and when we came to a T -junction we went left. That road led past an old station, now used as a private house, and to Corntown. Corntown is a hamlet of mostly old houses. Then we went back up the hill to Cornwood. Elizabeth Burrell.
